title: The Sixties The British Invasion CNN WS.XviD-err0001
description:
The Sixties: The British Invasion (CNN documentary)

A look at the influence British rock-and-roll had on American culture in the 1960s. Included: remarks by Smokey Robinson, Graham Nash, Ahmir "Questlove" Thompson, David Wild and Micky Dolenz. This documentary is brought to life through its extensive use of archival footage.

This aired on CNN HD on Jan 30, 2014. The quality is something like A8 V8 since it was recorded using analog methods.  

You can leave me comments at kickass or thepiratebay.

Description from CNN blog: The British Invasion begins with the breakthrough performance of The Beatles on The Ed Sullivan Show, which was watched by a record-setting 73 million viewers, blazing a culture-changing path through America fifty years ago next month. Those siren calls of The Animals, The Kinks, The Hollies, The Dave Clarke 5, The Who, and The Rolling Stones are all revisited in this paean to the power of the music that defined a generation Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and remain vital and relevant today.

The Ed Sullivan Show introducing The Beatles to America aired on Feb. 9, 1964, and their thrilling, mesmerizing appearance launched a revolution in fashion, hairstyles, advertising, politics, and sexual mores that have influenced virtually every aspect of modern American life.  Throughout the special, soul song legend Smokey Robinson; Graham Nash (of The Hollies and Crosby, Stills, Nash, and Young); Ahmir Ã¢â‚¬Å“QuestloveÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ Thompson, music journalist, record producer and drummer for the GrammyÃ‚Â® Award-winning band The Roots; rock columnist David Wild; Micky Dolenz of the American musical group, The Monkees; and more, all provide insights into how the Ã¢â‚¬Å“British invasionÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ was actually a reciprocal flow of influences back and forth with American artists.  The legendary era of Bob Dylan, Motown, The Beach Boys, and others, laid down the beats that formed the soundtrack of a generation.

THE SIXTIES: The British Invasion follows the strong ratings success of THE SIXTIES: The Assassination of JFK (1963), which was seen by 21.0 million total viewers and 8.2 million viewers in the coveted 25 to 54 age demo.  The Assassination of JFK (1963) and The British Invasion will air again when full THE SIXTIES series launches in May 2014.
